member.name: SECURITY_LOGON_TYPE
member.summary: The SECURITY_LOGON_TYPE enumeration indicates the type of logon requested by a logon process.

member.name: SECURITY_LOGON_TYPE.Interactive
member.summary: The security principal is logging on interactively.

member.name: SECURITY_LOGON_TYPE.Network
member.summary: The security principal is logging using a network.

member.name: SECURITY_LOGON_TYPE.Batch
member.summary: The logon is for a batch process.

member.name: SECURITY_LOGON_TYPE.Service
member.summary: The logon is for a service account.

member.name: SECURITY_LOGON_TYPE.Unlock
member.summary: The logon is an attempt to unlock a workstation.

member.name: SECURITY_LOGON_TYPE.NetworkCleartext
member.summary: The logon is a network logon with plaintext credentials.

member.name: SECURITY_LOGON_TYPE.NewCredentials
member.summary: Allows the caller to clone its current token and specify new credentials for outbound connections. The new logon session has the same local identity but uses different credentials for other network connections.

member.name: SECURITY_LOGON_TYPE.RemoteInteractive
member.summary: A terminal server session that is both remote and interactive.

member.name: SECURITY_LOGON_TYPE.CachedInteractive
member.summary: Attempt to use the cached credentials without going out across the network.

member.name: SECURITY_LOGON_TYPE.CachedRemoteInteractive
member.summary: Same as RemoteInteractive, except used internally for auditing purposes.

member.name: SECURITY_LOGON_TYPE.CachedUnlock
member.summary: The logon is an attempt to unlock a workstation.
